不管怎么说，生化奇兵：无限 依然是我玩过最好的FPS之一了

In many ways, this game is a downgrade from Bioshocks 1 and 2. It tries very hard to have the same impact, but the problem is that overall it's a collection of too many ideas (anarchism/communism vs the industrial magnate, the parallel universe theory, quantum physics supporting a city (lol), and various metaphysical/supernatural elements). No idea is given enough focus that it deserves and characters get forgotten pretty quick. The first two games had the strength of building the characters throughout the whole game. Elizabeth is also incredibly disappointing: her voice lines are canned and repetitive (what, this little lock? I'll give it a whirl) and she is not a character so much as a car that drives you from plot univers to plot universe. The overall writing is quite silly ("Wait a minute, that card....." and "Aren't you going to ask me it??" "what?" "My little finger!"). So in my view, the plot and story and dialogue and overall feel of bioshock infinite is subpar.



HOWEVER. That means that I look at Bioshock Infinite as a combat game and nothing more. People have criticized it for being a two-gun shooter with regenerating sheilds, and it's true. But it is without a doubt one of the finest two-gun shooters ever created. 

The vigors are a massive upgrade from Bioshock 1 and 2, and make up for the lack of gun choice. You are instead encouraged to move around the arenas, scavenging weapons from enemies to keep up variety, while hitting enemies with every tool on your belt with the vigor combinations. Every one is useful in some way, and on my playthroughs I usually rotated between 4 or 5 in almost constant use. 

The level design and overall aesthetic is fantastic. It's a floating city, enough said. The combat arenas are really a step forward in FPS design, with the rails and platform design making the arenas feel huge and vertical. Infinite definitely influenced other fast-paced shooters in this regard. Jumping off a rail, shooting somebody with lightning, blasting a crowd into the air, then dashing halfway across the map and exploding 5 levitating targets is an incredible feeling. Learn how the gear system works and how to combine vigors best and you'll feel like god. While there's a bunch I think this game got wrong, the combat is top-notch and that's why I love this game.

Для начала поставлю оценку. 9/10 

 Игра хороша во всём. 

Со стороны сюжета мы видим интересную историю с множеством неожиданных поворотов и философским подтекстом, прекрасное взаимодействие главных героев, из-за чего драмы чувствуются гораздо заметнее, а персонажи сильнее запоминаются, и прекрасный сеттинг стимпанка, который, возможно, не всем понравится, но любители подобного будут в восторге. 

 Со стороны геймплея мы видим динамичный шутер, не страдающий тиром, как последние CoD`ы, разбавляемый большим арсеналом оружия, в котором каждый ствол не похож на предыдущий, а так же способностей, каждая из которых поощряет исключительно свой стиль игры. Так же всё это уживается с подобием РПГ-систем брони ( а именно одежда с отдельными эффектами ) и средним разнообразием противников ( их не слишком много, чтоб вам было наплевать, но и не слишком мало, чтобы заскучать ).  

Исключительно рекомендую.

dlc23继续虐啊，不得不说成年的伊丽莎白和少女时期一比别有一番韵味。关键是，dlc2就算了，搞了半天操控的不是布克是失忆的先知，死了也就死了吧，dlc3伊丽莎白有了布克的幻觉，是啊，那个把你从塔里救出来，为你出生入死，血洗哥伦比亚的父亲，亦或是依靠?但不管怎么样，这个人已经不和你在一个时空了，你只能拥有他的幻象来抚慰自己，那一句“布克，我好想你”实在是让人心酸，这种跨越时空的想念是最动人的。最后失去超能力的伊丽莎白被反派乱棒打死，就这样匆匆结束了自己传奇的一生。
真的，希望你在另一个时空的位面，那个布克没有出卖你，而是把你抚养长大的时空里，你们都能有一个幸福安稳的人生。

The gameplay, graphics, art, presentation, general sci fi concepts, are all fine, and pretty good, especially given the time this came out. By those merits alone, this game is a bit of a modern classic.

However, being an exclusively single player game, it leans heavily on its writing and storytelling. The writing plays out like Brian the Dog heard of multiverse theory one day and immediately started writing depressing (yet surprisingly ultra violent) sci fi stories. There is this sense of dreary, self-loathing moralizing, which would be fine, if it actually went anywhere. The characters seem to have relatable elements on the surface but inevitably descend into a long-winded fallibility trap that is exhausting, aimless, stale, and unrewarding. None of the choices the player makes have any significant impact on the outcome.

The main game ending, while controversial, was not a dealbreaker; it actually seemed like it might be setting up the DLCs to resolve some of the self contradictions. Unfortunately, the DLCs play out so poorly, it actually ruins the whole experience leading up to them and it just makes the previous issues all the more ridiculous.

It doesn't sound like there will be any more Bioshock games, but hopefully Kevin will hire some writers for his next project.

If you haven't already picked this up, wait for deep discounts ($5 for the game and all DLCs).

[h1] BioShock Infinite [/h1]

[i] como é de se esperar, a história é envolvente do começo ao fim. As motivações do personagem principal não são claras no começo do gameplay, mas ao desenrolar da história tudo vai se explicando aos poucos. E não é pre-requisito jogar Bioshock 1 e 2 antes, uma vez que a história não tem nada a ver com os outros.

Inovação seria uma ótima palavra para definir esta obra de arte. Uma obra que conseguiu se desprender dos jogos anteriores, sem perder a essência do que o faz ser um BioShock.

Com acontecimentos bem anteriores ao primeiro jogo da franquia, tomando lugar em 1912, BioShock Infinite conta a história de um homem afundado em dívidas (Booker Dewitt), contratado para resgatar uma garota (Elizabeth) na cidade voadora de Columbia.
As tramas envolvendo a cidade, desde sua criação até seu governo atual, são extremamente bem desenvolvidas, mostrando o lado preconceituoso, hipócrita e ganancioso de um homem (tema já abordado anteriormente na franquia).
Repleto de ação muito boa, com jogabilidade fluída e combate incrível, apesar de repetitivo em certas partes. O fato de o jogador poder carregar apenas duas armas, faz com que se pare para realmente analisá-las e aumenta a tensão em combates.
Mesmo com a jogabilidade extraordinária e suas mecânicas divertidíssimas envolvendo os aerotrilhos, o foco principal é dado ao enredo e aos personagens. A história é sensacional, mexendo com fendas espaço-temporais e realidades paralelas. Tem uma trama super complexa e bem trabalhada, com revelações emocionantes, fazendo o desfecho ser de arrepiar.
Há, durante o game, pequenas ações dadas às escolhas do jogador, mas estas não influenciam em nada ao seu decorrer, o que é uma grande pena, mas não tira, de modo algum, o brilho desta obra.

BioShock Infinite é emotivo, essencialmente bem desenvolvido, inovador, extasiantemente lindo (em questões visuais, principalmente), com cenários bem modelados, e é com certeza um dos melhores jogos que eu já joguei. Compre agora, vale cada centavo! [/i]

几年前视频通关过看到打折决定自己通关一次，游戏剧情跟可玩性都挺高的。

12小时一周目，说实话我也不知道自己会不会有耐心再去打一遍两遍三遍，刷一个全成就来。

趁着夏季特惠的时候入了无限，本想着试试水，说不定好玩就就会把12也买咯，定下了暑假通关的目标，结果暑假过了一个月才正式通关，没有想象中的被深深圈粉，却多了一些不一样的感受。

最开始蒸汽朋克的黑科技风格深深地吸引了我，突突突加上魔法共同战斗的设定也是第一次尝试的类型，天空上的哥伦比亚美不胜收，云层里的屋顶都闪着金黄的光芒，天使模样的虹吸塔充满了光辉，我曾经一百次想要把某些场景截图保存，然鹅，windows自带的截图软件总是失败，也就没有过多纠结，只是手机里还留着一张云海的照片，和伊丽莎白即将坐船前往巴黎的那一刻，走进飞艇前，回头望就是一片海。

通关的一刻，被最后的结局小小地震撼了一把，同样还有超级多疑惑，于是成了第一部完整看完staff地游戏，途中上网搜罗了一堆分析，看过了梳理剧情地也看过了逼格满满分析文化要素的。有一句话说的很对，无限的跳票六年除了大把的经费更是把领先的技术和积累的口碑消耗殆尽。（这也是为什么不纠结截图的原因）

对于看多了电影的人来说，故事的结局并不会有太多意外，但伊丽莎白那缺失的小指，却成了男主角和玩家心里的痛。（含部分剧透）无数的门共处的星空是我觉得游戏里最美的场景，伊丽莎白对德怀特说：那不是星星，是门。一瞬间满天的星辰就成了无数的倒影。推开门之后的海岸，红霞和落日的轮廓，转过头去看到伊丽莎白正站在你的面前，望着你等你跟上她的脚步，那一刻我想我和男主一样，觉得先前的一切不过是一场梦。最后伤膝河里，围成一圈唱着颂歌的众人，伸出手的神父，突然反悔的德怀特，宗教的气息又给整个游戏蒙上了一股神秘的感觉。神父说接受洗礼就是重生，德怀特固执地推开，康姆斯托克却坦然地成为一个全新的人。

像很多评测说的那样，生化奇兵有着浓厚的反乌托邦气息，哥伦比亚本是一个美好的天顶城，私底下却有两股暗流，老旧的神论独裁者戏码，只是顺着游戏走下去，真的没想到救世主也是罪魁祸首，大概是没有玩过前两作，大概是没有领悟到伏笔（突突突太累了好不好）给人印象深刻的是革命军的章节，愿意提供武器的林先生无论在哪一个时空里都没有的到拯救，革命军为了所谓的自由却不惜毁掉整个哥伦比亚，，整个世界是荒诞的，整个世界的人也是疯狂的。

等完最后的彩蛋，我以为会是一段影片，听着耳边传来铃铛的声音，傻等一会，当我操控鼠标一转头时，德怀特才喊出那一声安娜，大概是，等我们与这个世界最后的交集，没有德怀特，也不再有伊丽莎白。

To put it simply, Bioshock Infinite is one of the best games ever made. It fully earns its 'overwhelmingly positive' reviews. Every aspect of the game is expertly crafted, from its astonishing story, to its satisfying combat, and of course its breathtaking world.
As with the original Bioshock, the focal point of the game is the setting. In a way, Rapture was the lead character in the original Bioshock, and it could be argued that Columbia is the same for Infinite. Visually, it is even more awe inspiring than Rapture, and I often found myself stopping just to look around and take it all in. Its not just cosmetic though, Columbia is fascinating to learn about, and just like Rapture its not as idyllic as it seems, though I obviously won't ruin the details.
What this game tends to be praised for the most though is its story, and it thoroughly deserves to be. The player controlled protagonist Booker DeWitt is well acted by Troy Baker, and his personal story is full of depth. The supporting protagonist Elizabeth is in my opinion the best supporting character, or 'follower' in any video game; both in terms of her role in the story and the way she works in the game itself. As a follower, Elizabeth is a breath of fresh air. She's interesting as a character sure, but she also finds you ammo, health, and salts (the new EVE) right when you really need them. You are never required to 'escort' her, and she has no direct role in combat. Elizabeth also moves around the world realistically, never getting in your way and reacting to events and points of interest in the world. The characters are excellent all around.
The actual gameplay itself is fantastic too. Gunplay feels fluid and accurate, and the variety of guns is on par with the original game. It is unfortunate though that gun upgrades don't provide a visual change like they did in Bioshock, but on the other hand there is way more variety. 'Vigors' replace the plasmids of the previous two games, though they work the same. The vigors of Bioshock Infinite are a lot more interesting though. Some are just reworked plasmids, but there are multiple ways to use each of them, and all in all they are very fun to use.
The only negative things I could say about Bioshock Infinite are nitpicks. The lack of visual representation for the gun upgrades, and fact that you can only carry two weapons at once rather than a whole arsenal are the only things I can think of, and they are really inconsequential. I do not believe that a perfect game exists, and for me at least, a 10/10 is not a perfect game, but a game that is absolutely unmissable, and considered a masterpiece. Bioshock Infinite succeeds in everything it sets out to do. For me, it even tops the original Bioshock, and any game that can do that is a masterpiece.

As a normal shooter, it's still decent. As a Bioshock game, it's quite a letdown.

To be short, the game takes after a completely different setting than the previous games before. It's much brighter, outside, and while the graphics and visuals look beautiful, there's a lot less to explore in the game. The map structure is much more linear, which isn't horrible, but there is far less backtracking and hidden secrets in the maps compared to the previous titles.

The AI is just laughable while they stand around shouting and waiting for you to approach them. On lower difficulties their aim is shoddy and on high difficulties they are still decently easy to defeat. The AI isn't all that exciting, there are more tasking than they are challenging. 

Elizabeth herself is a decent companion to have by your side. She doesn't do much though. Need ammo? She'll throw you some. Low on money? She's like a walking Meowth always coming up with more cash out of nowhere, but it's a nice plus nontheless. Her ability to tear placements within the map is rather a good idea in the game. It changed up some of the gameplay helping you to have an edge in some situations.

The weapons are really a big letdown to me. You can ONLY carry 2 weapons with you at a time, and it takes some of the fun out of the gameplay. The upgrades are still nice to have but they are expensive, leaving you a limited number of times you'll ever upgrade in-game. On top of the 2 weapon limit, you don't get to experience the other weapons and the potential they have as much, especially as you progress through the game. Lack of ammo was an issue in some parts of the game, possibly an issue since I was being liberal with my ammo at times.

The vigors (esentially the plasmids from the first 2 games) are decent, and rather interesting for combat. While a good portion of them aren't that great for most combat uses, I almost found myself playing the whole game without even needing to use them. They felt as if they were just there to make combat slightly more interesting. Essentially, it wasn't a bad thing, they are needed for very few places in some of the maps, but nothing more.

Lastly this story is just so fucking dull and boring. Literally, long-story-short, the story ends with you saying "That's it? That's the ending?". And while is does end on an unexpected note, it's nothing noteworthy. That's sometimes how some "political" storylines in games work. They shit out these bland stereotypes and characters that are so predictable with no reasoning for their motives.

It's not a horrible title, but it lacks core elements that made the previous games worthy and gave them replayability. I have not played the DLC's myself, honestly, I don't want to play the high price tag for them. I recommend getting this game ONLY when on sale if you are REALLY wanting to know how the series comes to a close.

There was also a lot of rather interesting content that was cut from the game before its final release. I feel if they would've stuck with some of the content from the original trailers and playthroughs, I might be more optimistic about this game. It's rather stunning what kind of transition it went through. If you're interesting the links are below:

Aunque respecto a la jugabilidad ha sido un paso hacia atrás, con apenas plasmidos comparado con el 1, o las opciones de pirateo, o que sea completamente lineal, sigue siendo un buen juego gracias a su narrativa y a sus personajes. 

Con personajes tan llamativos como los Gemelos Lutece, o la misma Elizabeth y la ciudad de Columbia que es preciosa con sus escenarios vistosos y esas opciones de jugabilidad que dan los aerocarriles, sin mencionar los desgarros. Y un final impactante. 

Buen juego, aunque lo mejor son las expansiones que explican los cabos sueltos que deja el juego.

[code] “La mente del sujeto luchará desesperadamente para crear recuerdos donde no los hay..." [/code]
Una pieza de arte traída desde la mismísima Columbia, Bioshock infinite nos encarna en el papel de Booker The Witt, un curioso personaje al cual se le es encargada una misión... y es el rescatar a una chica que se encuentra en la ciudad flotante de Columbia para poder saldar sus deudas, lo más parecido a el sueño renacentista de muchos artistas.

[h1] Historia [/h1]
En el apartado de historia / guión es espléndido, una de las mejores tramas que he jugado respecto a coherencia y el tejido de sus misiones, si bien en las primeras horas no entenderás el porqué de tu misión en el juego, a cuenta gotas todo se te desvelará, desde el más pequeño detalle... aunque parezca que fue un riesgo el cambiar de ciudad, ambientación y de todo,  no pudo haber mejor elección que esa, además argumentalmente cierra de manera magistral la trilogía.
Si bien la historia tendrá un estimado de 10/15 horas dependiendo de la dificultad, bastará para que quedes boquiabierto cuando empiecen a mostrarse los créditos, y tendrás ganas de más, y acá entran en juego los dlc's, si tienes la oportunidad de comprarlos, hazlo... tanto si haz jugado anteriores títulos como si no, se expande en gran manera la historia principal y el lore de la misma.
Además que se explicarán muchas cosas, y quizás hayan algunas sorpresas para aquellas personas que prestan mucha atención a los detalles.

[h1] Mecánicas/Gameplay [/h1]
Muchas mecánicas añadidas, desde nuevas formas de derrotar oponentes y desplazarse hasta el mejoramiento del gunplay, todo muy realista pero sobre todo cómodo a la hora de jugar, y te animará a combinar tus poderes y armas de fuego, al golpear a alguien  o simplemente correr de acá para allá notarás algo muy simple, todas las animaciones y movimientos son muy pulidos y fluidos, que harán tu estadía muy placentera, además que lo monótono de las misiones ya no se encuentra presente, muchas misiones variadas y con objetivos distintos.

[h1] Apartado Visual [/h1]
En lo que respecta al área gráfica es simplemente una belleza, el salto gráfico es muy notable, y a pesar de tener algunos años, se sigue viendo muy vigente el juego, mejorado muchos aspectos visuales y otros añadidos para darle el toque perfecto a la ambientación del juego.
Y aunque el toque ligeramente caricaturesco de los elementos pueda parecer extraño, realmente como conjunto tanto en paletas de colores como en modelados hace de una experiencia totalmente disfrutable al ojo.

[h1] OST/ Sonoro [/h1]
La música utilizada en batalla, suspenso y otros momentos te hace realmente estar en el rol del personaje, pues con “canticos celestiales” y otras melodías ambientales realmente el videojuego asume más allá del papel de ser el medio de juego, pasa a ser realmente una experiencia por si sola.
Si bien el trabajo de doblaje al castellano es correcto y bien llevado a cabo no destaca mucho, siendo recomendable jugarlo en su idioma nativo para la mayor fidelidad y calidad.
 
[h1] Consideraciones al jugar	[/h1]
Me gustaría mencionar detalles más específicos del videojuego, pero son detalles que vale la pena vivirlos en carne propia.
Es una experiencia única y me atrevo a decir que no hay título similar en todas sus características, una combinación perfecta entre shooter, ficción, acción y suspenso, es un título muy regulable y que para nada te dejará insatisfecho... Cómpralo sin pestañear, no te arrepentirás.
